protein.specific_function: Required for the phosphorylation of the deoxyribonucleosides deoxycytidine (dC), deoxyguanosine (dG) and deoxyadenosine (dA). Has broad substrate specificity, and does not display selectivity based on the chirality of the substrate. It is also an essential enzyme for the phosphorylation of numerous nucleoside analogs widely employed as antiviral and chemotherapeutic agents.

go_class.description: phosphotransferase activity, alcohol group as acceptor
nucleobase, nucleoside, nucleotide and nucleic acid metabolic process
phosphotransferase activity, alcohol group as acceptor
